symbols.docstring: - Added ES256 support to JWK parsing ([#399](https://github.com/firebase/php-jwt/pull/399)) - Fixed potential caching error in `CachedKeySet` by cachi
- Drop support for PHP 5.3, 5.4, 5.5, 5.6, and 7.0 - Add parameter typing and return types where possible
- **Backwards-Compatibility Breaking Changes**: See the [Release Notes](https://github.com/firebase/php-jwt/releases/tag/v6.0.0) for more information.
- Support RS384 and RS512. See [#117](https://github.com/firebase/php-jwt/pull/117). Thanks [@joostfaassen](https://github.com/joostfaassen)! - Add an
- Add support for late static binding. See [#88](https://github.com/firebase/php-jwt/pull/88) for details. Thanks to [@chappy84](https://github.com/ch
- Minimum PHP version updated from `5.2.0` to `5.3.0`. - Add `\Firebase\JWT` namespace. See [#59](https://github.com/firebase/php-jwt/pull/59) for det
- Add support for adding custom, optional JWT headers to `JWT::encode()`. See [#53](https://github.com/firebase/php-jwt/pull/53/files) for details. Th
- Add support for adding a leeway to `JWT:decode()` that accounts for clock skew between signing and verifying entities. Thanks to [@lcabral](https://
- **Note**: It is strongly recommended that you update to > v2.0.0 to address known security vulnerabilities in prior versions when both symmetric and
When a call to `JWT::decode` is invalid, it will throw one of the following exceptions:
symbols.name: Exception Handling

symbols.docstring: The return value of `JWT::decode` is the generic PHP object `stdClass`. If you'd like to handle with arrays instead, you can do the following:
